reviews.review: Played on console, then got it on Steam. Incredible. Best singleplayer game ever made.

The game's quality stays consistently outstanding throughout, there isn't a minute of filler content to be found anywhere in single-player or co-op. A [b]hilarious slice[/b] of gaming glory.
[i]Rating: 9/10[/i]

I loved this game and everything about it. At times I would stare at a test chamber with just no clue of how to answer it. But I'm proud to say i didn't have to look up the solution to a single puzzle.
If you've played Portal and loved it this will truly blow you away!!!

legal mais chato

The story is amazing, the humor overflows bountifully, the environments are huge and fill me with a deep sense of desolation, the art is simple and beautiful, and the gameplay is as fluid as the original. 

Walking through the abandoned ruins of old aperture is a treat in and of itself, but the puzzles are unlike anything any other game has ever given me. The solutions for many of the puzzles are the kind of thing that would pop into your head and then be ignored for being too stupid to work, which takes getting used to but is such a pleasure when you find out that it actually works. Crawling through the hulking dilapidated geodesic spheres filled with still-functioning 50-year old experiments that never saw the light of day evokes a profound sadness at what could have been, something that is very emotional without being particularly exposition-heavy. Despite the injection of humor, the story of Cave Johnson and his assistant is terribly tragic and I'd be lying if I said it didn't weigh heavily on me throughout the rest of the game. Sure, the puzzles are harder (by an order of magnitude, I'd say) than the original, but what really stuck with me was how immersive and vast the world is in comparison. It certainly helps that the "Half Life 2 Mod" aesthetic of the original portal has been replaced with custom UI development, because that was one thing I positively hated about the original.

Not since I completed World of Goo have I been so distraught at coming to the end of a game. Portal 2 is a complete all-around experience that I reckon will stick with me forever, and I wouldn't have it any other way. You're doing yourself a favor playing this game.

Highly recommend, but it is my favorite game, so of course I would. The story and gameplay: co-op and single, are entertaining and make you use your head a bit. Bonus: if you get this game, you open it up for the community made mods that are equally as good and/or challenging.

Otra joya de Valve, narrativa de 10, puzzles con una dificultad perfecta puesto que no son fáciles pero a la vez no tienen una dificultad exagerada como para quedarnos atascados y dejar de jugarlo. Además, si ya a esto le sumas poder jugarlo con un amigo de foma cooperativa te queda una OBRA MAESTRA con todas las letras.

En definitiva, Portal 2 es uno de esos videojuegos que nos da la razón a todos los que consideramos a los videojuegos.... un arte.

Portal 2 restera une expérience unique au format narratif qui fait figure d'exemple. Les expériences vidéoludiques m'ayant laissé bouche bée se comptent sur les doigts d'une main. Parmi elle il y a cette revisite des décors du premier Portal, cette fois dévastés, au début de Portal 2. C'est un jeu qui m'a toujours fasciné. Cette impression qu'un univers entier se cache derrière le level-design, je ne l'ai jamais vraiment retrouvé dans aucun autre jeu. Cette façon de faire vivre son monde, non plus. 
Portal 2, c'est le second opus parfait : l'univers introduit dans le un est redéveloppé et redécouvert tandis que les mécaniques de jeu sont renouvelées et améliorées. C'est plus grand, plus démesuré et original, une oeuvre qui a eu son impact sur le visage du jeu vidéo actuel.
One of the best gemes i have ever played

Portal 2 is really a fantastic game along with Portal 1 and the Half-Life series. Not only doesit provide a creative form of puzzle solving, but it presents a colorful story with a long string of comedy.

★★★✰✰
Single player story wasn't as gripping as the first one, but I guess it was always going to be hard to follow. Co-op mode makes it worth the purchase.

Tahle hra byla pro mě takový klenot. Byla to totiž první příběhovka, kterou jsem dohrál až do konce, pak následovala teprve jednička, nicméně z mého pohledu pro mě zůstane srdcovkou právě dvojka. Má lepší grafiku, ovládání a především díky komunitním mapám má stále velký potenciál v učení se nových technik a myšlení, což v jedničce nenajdeme, ovšem to jí vytýkat nemůžu. 
Po příběhový stránce je hra fakt vydařená a to i přes to, že navazuje na první díl a já ho v době prvního průchodu neznal, byla hra schopna mě dost ohromit a stejně jsem si příběh užil. Abych zase moc nechválil, jak je příběh skvělý i když jsem nehrál první díl, tak po jedničce jsem si hru prošel a užil jsem si ho ještě víc.
Samozřejmě hra má bugy, ale pokud je vyloženě nehledám, tak tady zase tak moc požitek ze hry nekazí, takže já jsem s tím docela v pohodě.
Na konec bych to shrnul prostě pozitivně. Hra je pěkná, vtipná, nenásilná, prostě dobrá. 

[spoiler] Nechť si Wheatly na měsíci/ve  vesmíru třeba okusuje palce, stejně jsem ho neměl nikdy rád.	[/spoiler]

Portal 2 рилли годная игра. Valve постарались на славу!

Sporting some of the best writing and voice work in years (as well as some deviously designed puzzles), Portal 2's single-player campaign is superior to its predecessor in every way. It's the co-op mode, however, that makes this 2011's first must-play game -- even for those gamers that don't like first-person or puzzle games.

Let's be honest, this game is probably one of the top classics not only in the Valve collection, but on all of Steam. Besides having stunning graphics, amazing gameplay, challenging puzzles, and hilarious content, it also contains a great co-op campaign which makes great use of the portal concept and the community "test chambers" add endless additional challenging user generated maps. A great sequal to an already amazing title. If you haven't already played this, yet, I highly advise giving it a shot... you won't regret it!
